text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- King Hassan presides over Eid al-Adha prayer and receives congratulations from senior officials.
- King Hassan hails large Moslem support for al Qods (Jerusalem) cause.
- Government forecasts a gross domestic product growth fall in 1997.
- Arab Monetary Fund lends Morocco $38.25 million to purchase crude sulphur from Saudi Arabia.
- Morocco signs accord with the United Nations on development of northern provinces.
- Prince Moulay Rachid inaugurates an Olympic-sized swimming pool in Rabat.
- Morocco lawyers hold congress in Fes on April 24.
- The 1997-1998 budget allows more resources for social development programmes.
- Morocco exported 2,400 tonnes of orange to Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates in 1996.
